title: Ticket #2401: Turn DC_DAEMON_LIST into DAEMON specific features
description:
We currently have (at least) - where <DAEMON> comes from DAEMON_LIST, 

<DAEMON>_FLAG
<DAEMON>_ENVIRONMENT
MASTER_<DAEMON>_CONTROLLER
MASTER_<DAEMON>_BACKOFF_CONSTANT
MASTER_<DAEMON>_BACKOFF_CEILING
MASTER_<DAEMON>_BACKOFF_FACTOR
MASTER_<DAEMON>_RECOVER_FACTOR
<DAEMON>_USERID
<DAEMON>_ARGS
<DAEMON>_ADMIN_EMAIL
<DAEMON>_WATCH_FILE
<DAEMON>_LOG
HA_<DAEMON>_LOCK_URL
HA_<DAEMON>_LOCK_HOLD_TIME
HA_<DAEMON>_POLL_PERIOD

All these params tell the Master how to behave wrt the daemon.

Then we have DC_DAEMON_LIST, which tells the master to start the daemon with -f, create a DC socket and try to kill it in a certain way. DC_DAEMON_LIST has proved difficult to manage, resulting in the addition of special config syntax for it alone (=+).

I propose we properly deprecate DC_DAEMON_LIST in favor of at least <DAEMON>_ISDC = True|False. Even better would be to break out the specific features bundled under ISDC, or "being DC", such as the -f, the DC socket, the kill method.

A similar approach should be taken for MASTER_HA_LIST, turning it into <DAEMON>_IS_HA = True|False (default being False).

A sub-task would be to rationalize the existing params, e.g. MASTER_<DAEMON> -> <DAEMON> and HA_<DAEMON> -> <DAEMON>_HA.

This will give us a clean definition of DAEMONs.
